title: Sri Lanka social media platforms inaccessible, curfew breakers arrested
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka social media users say they cannot access most popular platforms and police said curfew breakers were arrested as the country remains under a emergency rule amid protests over an economic crisis.
Social media activists had planned national protests at several locations on Sunday but authorities imposed a curfew until Monday shortly after promulgating emergency rule.
On Saturday night some activists defied the curfew to gather in protest and also broadcast social media
Police said from 2200 on April 02 to 0600 April 03, 664 curfew breakers were arrested in the Western province.
“Operations will be conducted during the curfew period to find those who break it,” police said.
Sri Lanka’s Ada Derana news in a text messages quoted the the telecom regulator as saying that several social media platforms have been blocked on the instructions of the Ministry of Defence.
